subject: Physics
review: Dr. Johnson's passion for physics is contagious. Her lectures are engaging and she explains complex concepts clearly.

subject: Computer Science
review: Prof. Chen is knowledgeable and approachable. His coding assignments are challenging but rewarding.

subject: Biology
review: Dr. Rodriguez brings biology to life with her interactive labs and real-world examples. Highly recommended!

subject: History
review: Prof. Thompson knows his subject well, but his lectures can be dry at times. More engaging discussions would help.

subject: Psychology
review: Dr. Patel's course is eye-opening. She encourages critical thinking and provides great insights into human behavior.

subject: Mathematics
review: Prof. Garcia rushes through material and doesn't explain concepts thoroughly. Office hours are helpful though.

subject: Chemistry
review: Dr. Lewis is an exceptional educator. Her lab demonstrations are amazing and she's always willing to help students.

subject: English Literature
review: Prof. Wilson's analysis of classic literature is insightful. His essay prompts encourage creative thinking.

subject: Sociology
review: Dr. Brown's lectures are informative, but the workload can be overwhelming at times. More guidance on assignments would be appreciated.

subject: Economics
review: Prof. Lee makes economics accessible and interesting. His real-world examples help connect theory to practice.

subject: Art History
review: Dr. Martinez's passion for art is evident. Her virtual museum tours are a highlight of the course.

subject: Political Science
review: Prof. Kim presents balanced viewpoints on complex issues. However, class discussions could be more structured.

subject: Environmental Science
review: Dr. Green's course is eye-opening. The field trips and guest lectures provide valuable hands-on experience.

subject: Philosophy
review: Prof. Taylor challenges students to think deeply. His Socratic method of teaching encourages active participation.

subject: Neuroscience
review: Dr. Wong is at the forefront of her field. Her lectures are fascinating and she explains complex concepts clearly.

subject: Marketing
review: Prof. Adams relies too heavily on outdated textbooks. More current case studies and examples would improve the course.

subject: Linguistics
review: Dr. Volkov's enthusiasm for languages is inspiring. The course offers a great mix of theory and practical applications.

subject: Mechanical Engineering
review: Prof. Hughes is knowledgeable, but his teaching style can be confusing. More practice problems would be helpful.

subject: Anthropology
review: Dr. Ahmed's course is a journey through human cultures. Her fieldwork stories bring the subject to life.

subject: Music Theory
review: Prof. Nelson makes music theory accessible to non-musicians. His listening exercises are particularly enlightening.
